verse.roman:
brahmaṇā preṣito devān
devarṣir nārado nṛpa
vārayām āsa vibudhān
dṛṣṭvā dānava-saṅkṣayam

synonyms: brahmaṇā—by Lord Brahmā; preṣitaḥ—sent; devān—unto the demigods; deva-ṛṣiḥ—the great sage of the heavenly planets; nāradaḥ—Nārada Muni; nṛpa—O King; vārayām āsa—forbade; vibudhān—all the demigods; dṛṣṭvā—after seeing; dānava-saṅkṣayam—the total annihilation of the demons.
translation: O King, when Lord Brahmā saw the imminent total annihilation of the demons, he sent a message with Nārada, who went before the demigods to make them stop fighting.
